page.title: 03WEATHER
page.content: When people come to live in{Clifton- {on-Teme}they soon realise that we have a wide variety of{weather.}We often have heavy{snowfalls}in the winter and it is usual for the village to be cut off for a day or two. There are often deep{snowdrifts}on the roads into the village and the hills near{Clifton}and {Upper Sapey}are often blocked by big vehicles unable to move on the{icy {roads.}The{River Teme}reacts very quickly to heavy{rainfall}and there are times when the{floods}have prevented cars using{Ham bridge. There are often{gale force winds}on the exposed hills and these have been known to cause considerable damage. The {weather }is not aways bad because, being quite high up, the area has fine{sunny weather}when Worcester is covered in autumn mists. by{Paul Brooks}&{Patrick Turner
